results.title: ‘I Did All I Could’: As Floodwaters Rose, She Fought to Save Her Disabled Brothers
results.abstract: Darcy Bishop for decades has cared for her two brothers, who have cerebral palsy. Hurricane Ian was her biggest test yet.

media.caption: Darcy Bishop cleaned up her home after it flooded from Hurricane Ian in Naples, Fla.
media.copyright: Jason Andrew for The New York Times

results.title: Putin Just Told Us What He’s Planning
results.abstract: Amid the bluster and veiled threats, the president made three distinct points that form a blueprint for war and peace.

results.adx_keywords: Hurricane Ian (2022);Rescues;Floods;Deaths (Fatalities);Coastal Areas;Fort Myers (Fla);Sanibel Island (Fla);Pine Island (Fla)
results.byline: By Jennifer Reed, Patricia Mazzei and Jack Healy
results.title: On Florida’s Islands, Scenes of Paradise Lost, Maybe for Good
results.abstract: On Fort Myers Beach, Sanibel Island and Pine Island, cherished landmarks and an easygoing existence were obliterated by Hurricane Ian.

media.caption: Rescue workers in Fort Myers Beach on Thursday.
media.copyright: Hilary Swift for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Vaccination and Immunization;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Polls and Public Opinion;California;Marin County (Calif)
results.title: Once Known for Vaccine Skeptics, Marin Now Tells Them ‘You’re Not Welcome’
results.abstract: The wealthy California county just north of San Francisco has one of the nation’s highest Covid-19 vaccination rates after years of being known for parents who opposed shots for childhood diseases.

media.caption: Karen Casas, 4, of Marin County receiving her first Covid-19 vaccine.

results.adx_keywords: Decisions and Verdicts;Discrimination;Colleges and Universities;Polls and Public Opinion;Admissions Standards;Affirmative Action;Voting Rights Act (1965);Race and Ethnicity;Roberts, John G Jr;Harvard University;Supreme Court (US)
results.title: As New Term Starts, Supreme Court Is Poised to Resume Rightward Push
results.abstract: The justices return to the bench on Monday to start a term that will include major cases on affirmative action, voting and discrimination against gay couples. Several will take on questions about race.

media.caption: As president, Donald J. Trump appointed three justices to the Supreme Court, including Amy Coney Barrett.

results.adx_keywords: Fishing, Sport;Fish and Other Marine Life;Cheating;Chase Cominsky;Jacob Runyan;Cleveland (Ohio);Lake Erie
results.title: Fishing Contest Rocked by Cheating Charges After Weights Found in Winning Catches
results.abstract: Two competitors stuffed walleye with lead balls in a scheme that was caught after the tournament director and attendees grew suspicious.

media.caption: A walleye taken from Lake Erie near Marblehead, Ohio.

results.byline: By Muktita Suhartono, Sui-Lee Wee and Dera Menra Sijabat
results.title: Fans Focus on Police After More Than 100 Die at Indonesian Soccer Match
results.abstract: Witnesses said officers fired tear gas indiscriminately into the stands, causing a stampede that led to at least 125 deaths.

results.adx_keywords: Political Prisoners;United States International Relations;Amnesties, Commutations and Pardons;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Flores de Freitas, Francisco;Flores, Cilia;Flores, Efrain Antonio Campo;Maduro, Nicolas;Namazi, Siamak;United Nations;Venezuela;Iran
results.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Farnaz Fassihi
results.title: American Prisoners Are Released From Venezuela and Iran
results.abstract: Caracas freed seven Americans in a trade for two nephews of Venezuela’s first lady who had been convicted on drug charges. Separately, Tehran released its longest-held American captive.

media.caption: The Americans released by Venezuela included several executives of the Citgo oil refining company, who had been detained more than four years ago.

results.title: There’s Still One Big Trick for Getting Into an Elite College
results.abstract: And it can be yours for just four yearly payments of $50,000!

results.byline: By Dera Menra Sijabat and Sui-Lee Wee
results.title: A fan says he can still hear the ‘voices screaming.’
results.abstract: One witness said most of the victims were people trapped in the stands, not those on the field. Without tear gas “there would have not been any casualties,” he said.

media.caption: At the Kanjuruhan Stadium on Sunday.

results.adx_keywords: Social Media;Hurricanes and Tropical Storms;Sharks;Hoaxes and Pranks;News and News Media;Hurricane Ian (2022);Fort Myers (Fla)
results.title: For Once, the Hurricane Shark Was Real
results.abstract: Shark memes have become synonymous with social media hoaxes. But an A.P. analysis and experts say a wayward finned creature was indeed captured on video swimming on a street in Fort Myers, Fla., this week.

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Mixed Martial Arts;Medical Marijuana;Theodorou, Elias;Ultimate Fighting Championship;Canada
results.title: Elias Theodorou, Pioneer of Medical Marijuana in Sports, Dies at 34
results.abstract: A Canadian mixed martial artist, he brought cerebral flair to the ring and a dogged determination to his campaign for changing the sport’s drug rules.

media.caption: Elias Theodorou, right, in 2018 in a middleweight mixed martial arts bout with Eryk Anders of the United States in Toronto. He was already a widely admired sports figure when he took up the cause of medical marijuana.

results.title: Ukraine Forces Retake Lyman, a Strategic City, as Russians Retreat
results.abstract: Russia’s withdrawal from the city comes one day after Moscow illegally annexed the surrounding region.

results.title: Tensions That Roiled English City Have Roots in India
results.abstract: Violent confrontations in Leicester have prompted soul searching in an area long heralded as a success story of diversity and integration among its large Indian diaspora.

media.caption: A predominantly Muslim area of Leicester, England. Experts say the tangles between mostly Hindu and Muslim men last month were only the latest examples of how toxic politics in India have migrated overseas.
media.copyright: Andrew Testa for The New York Times

results.title: Here’s why Russia’s retreat from Lyman matters.

results.title: Backing Lindt, Swiss Court Orders Lidl to ‘Destroy’ Its Chocolate Bunnies
results.abstract: With Easter still far away, there are none to melt down. But the decision opened a door on the bunny-eat-bunny world of European chocolatiers.

media.caption: Lindt, the Swiss chocolate maker, is protective of its “Gold Bunny.”

results.title: What to Do if You’re Experiencing Hair Loss After Covid
results.abstract: Increased shedding after illness is not unusual. The good news is that it’s most likely temporary.

results.title: Hurricane Orlene Expected to Hit Western Mexico on Monday
results.abstract: Orlene, a Category 3 storm, could bring as much as 14 inches of rain to some areas, forecasters said. The system is expected to weaken after landfall.

media.caption: A satellite image of Hurricane Orlene on Sunday. The storm could bring flash flooding and landslides across southwest Mexico through Tuesday, forecasters said.
media.copyright: Agence France-Presse, via National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration

results.title: The Story Behind DeSantis’s Migrant Flights to Martha’s Vineyard
results.abstract: Asylum seekers in Texas were recruited for the flights by a woman who appeared to be a former Army counterintelligence agent. “We were tricked,” one migrant said.

results.byline: By Patricia Mazzei and Johnny Milano
results.title: On Sanibel Island, a Search for Stranded Residents Slogs On
results.abstract: About 200 households did not leave ahead of Hurricane Ian. Rescue teams are tracking down the stranded and evacuating them — if they are willing.

media.caption: A neighbor watched as the Stasi family evacuated Sanibel, Fla.
